availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Durrett W. Tribble (Madison County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer, teacher, and soldier. Madison County native. Son of John Tribble and Martha White Tribble. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Member of volunteer reserve company in Richmond, Kentucky, in March 1861. Prisoner at Camp Chase, Ohio, released on November 11, 1862. Teacher in Madison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 249B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 1-2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 377.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 20.
"Unfiled Papers and Slips Belonging in Confederate Compiled Service Records" NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M347, Roll 0397.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Madison County, KY, July 1863, p. 156, (Accessed via ancestry.com on September 13, 2019).
Find A Grave, "Durrett W Tribble (1842-1908)," Memorial #200003372, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20003372# (accessed December 7, 2018).
